intro: Boehmeria ourantha, commonly known as the Chinese nettle or Indian nettle, is a flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries like China, India, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and small, greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Boehmeria ourantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has been used traditionally in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
